title: Dead Christ with Angels

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of copperplate, etched and aquatinted.

inscriptions: Stamped verso, left edge: "CARON / 17 / RUE DES VIEUX AUGUSTINS"
publication_history: Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Manet (Librairie Floury, 1944), n.pag., under no. 34. Jean C. Harris, Edouard Manet: Graphic Works, A Definitive Catalogue Raisonné (Collectors Editions, 1970), p. 145. Juliet Wilson-Bareau, Manet: Dessins, aquarelles, eaux-fortes, lithographies, correspondence, exh. cat. (Huguette Berès, 1978), cat. 93, n.pag. Jay McKean Fisher, The Prints of Edouard Manet, exh. cat. (International Exhibitions Foundation, 1985), p. 74. Kimio Nakayama, Mane Ten Katarogu Henshū Iinkai, and Isetan Bijutsukan, Mane ten = Édouard Manet, exh. cat. (Āto Raifu, 1986), cat. 75b, pp. 101 (ill.), 139, and 170. Jean C. Harris, Edouard Manet: Graphic Works, A Definitive Catalogue Raisonné, rev. ed. (Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1990), p. 158. “Manet, Cat. 7, Dead Christ with Angels,” in Manet Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago (Art Institute of Chicago, 2017), https://publications.artic.edu/manet/reader/manetart/section/140020.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galerie Huguette Berès, Manet: Dessins, aquarelles, eaux-fortes, lithographies, correspondance, 1978, cat. 93, n.pag.

Art Institute of Chicago, Manet as Printmaker: Works from the Permanent Collection, Apr. 20–Sept. 12, 1985, no cat.

Tokyo, Isetan Museum of Art, Edouard Manet, June 26–July 29, 1986, cat. 75b, pp. 101 (ill.), 139, and 170; Fukuoka Art Museum, Aug. 2–31, 1986; Osaka Municipal Museum of Art, Sept. 9–Oct. 12, 1986.
provenance_text: Henri-Charles Guérard (1846–1897), Paris; by descent to his son Jean-Raymond Guérard (1883–?), to at least 1944 [Guérin 1944].  Huguette Berès, Paris, by 1976 [according to Juliet Wilson-Bareau].  Sold by Robert M. Light and Company, Santa Barbara, Cal., to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1984.
on_loan_display: On loan to Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City for Manet Degas
section_titles: Cat. 7  Dead Christ with Angels, Copperplate, 1866/67
